title: New Years Day Ride - CRCA
description: Meet at 8:00 at Engineer's Gate
course:
2 laps around Central Park, north using St. Nicholas Avenue to the GWB, to 9 W North.

• The course detours just South of Nyack

• You can either climb up just before entering Nyack
Or
• go through Nyack and use any of the access roads back west to 9 W

Either way you will climb Rockland Hill and continue on 9 W for the rest of the ride.

Up to Bear Mtn/Perkins

The return is the same route, finishing up by turning Left @ 110th St & riding South on Fifth Avenue to 90th St.
registration: Print and sign your own USAC event release form.  Hand in at Engineer's Gate.
notes:
Dress appropriately for the weather
Completed and signed USAC liability release
During & post-Ride nutrition
Report to start 5-10 minutes before start time
directions: Central Park

title: Cazenovia Fat Bike Race
description: The Cazenovia Fat Bike Race presented by Empire Brewing Company and Syracuse Bicycle is an event that will beat your dreary CNY winter blues and makes bike racing fun again! For beginners and experts alike, the race includes tech support by Syracuse Bicycle, award winning Empire Brewing Company beer and food, fat bike demos, games and contests, awards and prizes, and great music! Be sure to bring along the family & friends to cheer you on. We guarantee they will have as much fun as you will.
course:
Be prepared to ride approximately 10-15 miles in lap format on the rolling terrain of Empire Farm Brewery. Course design is weather dependent and will be marked with stakes. A course map will be available on race day only. Riders will begin the race with a mass start. 
Between each lap, all participants stop to play Hammerschlagen - our version of the German Drinking game where you pound a 3.5 inch nail with a hammer into a burly piece of wood.
After a racer passes the finish line, they must take their number plate off their bike, run over and place it into the bucket inside of the ring of tires. The first person to put their Number Plate in the fat tire bucket after completing all laps will be named the category winner. 

If another racer crosses the finish line after you, but gets their number plate in the bucket BEFORE you, they will be placed ahead of you in the final standings. Racers that lose their Number Plate during the race will have to make a new one at the registration tent. No exceptions.
We have five categories: Juniors <18; Men 18+ Elite & Citizen; Women 18+ Elite & Citizen. All riders self select themselves into Elite/Citizen categories, following these simple guidelines:  Elite=You're Fast. Citizen=You're Here For Fun! 
Top 3 in each category will win awards. Door prizes from our sponsors. Commemorative Pint glass to all finishers.
registration:
Registration is available at www.bikereg.com/cazenovia-fat-bike-race
Single race fee 18+ - $40 preregister, $50 day of
Juniors - $15 preregister, $20 day of
Rider cap will be 100 riders.
notes:
Riders must have the following: 
1. Cycling specific helmet. CPSC, ANSI or SNELL approved. Chinstraps must be fastened and helmet properly fit.
2. Number plate attached to the front of the bike 
3. Fat Bike*** (Tires 3.7” or wider) 
4. Eye protection strongly recommended. Googles work best to avoid fogging
5 Handle bar ends must have plugs.
Not allowed: 

1. Ear buds or audio devices of any kind. 
2. Do not use any sort of glass container, if found race officials will take it. 
4. Absolutely no littering!
If you drop out of the race, you will need to call or text 315-263-7575 and provide name and race plate number. If you register and check into the race but decide not to race, call or text 315-263-7575 and provide name, race plate number. Pay attention to course signage. No outside help. Help only from other racers or aid station personnel. No caching of food or supplies along course. If you come across a racer in need of help, contact 315-263-7575.
Weather Contingency Plan
Warning! This is a winter event. Expect winter conditions. Weather in Central New York in February can vary from wet and warm to sub zero temperatures and extreme snow and ice. Please dress and prepare accordingly. The event promoter reserves the right to shorten, cancel or postpone the event if weather conditions threaten the safety of participants and race volunteers. In the event of cancellation or postponement there will be NO REGISTRATION REFUNDS. Post event party at Empire Farm Brewing will proceed as planned regardless of weather.
directions:
From Syracuse
I-481 to Exit for Dewitt/Fayetteville
Follow Rt. 5 to Fayetteville. At fork in road, bear right to follow Rt. 92 to Cazenovia. Turn left on Rt. 20. Turn right on Rt. 13/Rippleton Rd. Empire Farm Brewery is on the right side.

title: CRCA Grant's Tomb Criterium
description: Century Road Club Association 2017 Grant's Tomb Criterium
course: The Grant’s Tomb Criterium course is located on Riverside Drive between 120 Street.
registration: No day-of registration for the race. All registration must be completed in advance on bikereg you have questions about registration please contact bikereg@crca.net
notes:
WAIT LIST will be cleared in order of registration. If you do not get cleared from the waitlist you will be refunded in cash (must be in attendance to receive refund). 

Sign-in/Number pick-up closes 10 minutes to field start. If you have not signed-in and picked up your number, your spot will be given to a waitlist rider.
directions: The Grant’s Tomb Criterium course is located on Riverside Drive between 120 Street.  The course is accessible via bike, car, and subway. Parking is available on Riverside Drive north of the Grant’s Tomb course on the viaduct.  If you are taking the subway, one option is to take the 1 train to the 116th Street - Columbia University station.

title: Check Your Legs Road Race
description: 12.5 mile hilly road race of 2 to 4 laps depending on category. 39x25 gearing recommended.    Course is on  low traffic roads. 4 right hand turns.    Preregistration only via Bikereg.
course: 12.5 mile 4 right hand turn course with 2 significant climbs.   Uphill finish.   Course is in good condition on small low traffic roads.
registration: Registration will be open until 4-28-17 on Bikereg.   Online registration only.  Riders will be emailed race instructions prior to the event.
notes: Classic road event.   Low cost no frills race.   Uphill finish for quick and accurate placings.
directions: Race start is at 908 County Highway 16 in Garrattsville , NY.  Easy access via State Route 51 from the North or South.

title: Macho Foundation Mtn Bike Race
description:
The Bicycle Planet
MACHO Mtn Bike Race
May 20th, 2017
Start Time: 8:00 a.m. CAT 3
Start Time: 11:00 a.m. CAT 1 & CAT 2
Stillwell Woods Preserve, Woodbury, New York

CAT 1: 18miles CAT 2: 12miles CAT3: 5miles
FAT TIRE & SINGLE SPEED Cat 1 & 2 Only

Benefiting The MACHO Foundation.
My. Actions. Can. Help. Others.
course:
CAT 1: 18miles CAT 2: 12miles CAT3: 5miles
FAT TIRE & SINGLE SPEED Cat 1 & 2 Only
notes:
Race Day
6:45 a.m. Race Site Check-in OPENS
7:40 a.m. SHARP Check-in CLOSES CAT 3
7:45 a.m. Pre-Race Briefing
7:50 a.m. National Anthem
8:00 a.m. CAT 3/RACE START
9:30 a.m. Trail Run Race Starts
10:40 a.m. SHARP Check-in CLOSES CAT 1 & CAT 2
11:00 a.m. CAT 1 & CAT 2 RACE START
11:15 a.m. Awards Ceremony Starts CAT 3
1:30 p.m. Awards Ceremony CAT 1 & CAT 2
directions:
See MAP:- https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/viewer?hl=en&authuser=1&mid=1O0H-LssRvkSSI7amTJnqdUrVg5A&ll=40.83232425590449%2C-73.47830859999999&z=16 

Enter the Park off South Woods Road, Syosset.

A 270-acre preserve and multiple-use area under the aegis of the Nassau County Department of Parks, Recreation and Museums, Stillwell Woods offers a blend of old field and oak barrens communities, the latter of which includes plants and animals that are more typical of habitats farther east on Long Island. The Nassau-Suffolk Greenbelt Trail for hikers runs through the preserve. There are also bicycle trails and equestrian trails. A 30.9-acre portion of the preserve is leased to the Town of Oyster Bay for use as playing fields.
www.nassaucountyny.gov/agencies/Parks/WhereToGo/preserves/index.html

title: WTF Track Skills Clinic
description:
Formula Femme will be hosting a skills clinic for Women-Trans-Femme GNC riders each month at Kissena Velodrome in Flushing, NY. This clinic will be for the rider who has already taken an intro course and wants to sharpen their skills and learn more.

Each clinic will begin with a structured warm-up, followed shortly after with on-the-bike race training.
course: June 4th 9a-11a : Mass start races and the tactics that go along with them. After practice we will host an unofficial omnium for glory.
registration: Register on bikereg page, registration will close on midnight two nights prior to the event. Payment not accepted on site.
notes: Check in for the clinic will open at 8:30a, please arrive on time and be ready to ride by 9a. We only have use of the track for a short amount of time and want to pack as much fun in as possible.
directions:
Take the 7 Train to the last stop in Flushing (Main Street)
Ride south on Kissena Blvd to the Velodrome, approx 5 min.

title: The Rock Criterium
description: Under the title sponsorship of American Rock Salt, The Rock Criterium and Gran Fondo is a two-day bicycling celebration that provides a unique format of racing and riding. This year's event will couple race categories for riders of all abilities and ages on Saturday with a scenic, professionally supported timed ride and party for recreational riders of all abilities and ages on Sunday.
course: 6-turn course that features left and right corners, two short up and down hill sections and one fast s-curve all on a .9-mile loop.
notes:
*****NEW PAYOUT SCHEDULE****** 

We are excited to announce a new payout schedule for this year's race!

Breakdowns are the same for men's and women's races with a guaranteed minimum for each field. Prize money then increases in an escalating format that pays more to larger fields.

See the breakdown below on how to max your fields, and max your payouts!

Field: Men’s 4/5 
Guaranteed Min = $100 for 20 or fewer riders
Increase = $5 per rider for every rider over 20 up to 75 max

Fields: Men’s 3/4 and Women’s 3/4/5
Guaranteed Min = $150 for 20 or fewer riders
Increase = $7 per rider for every rider over 20 up to 75 max

Field: Rock Run (combined genders)
Guaranteed Min = $200 for 20 or fewer runners
Increase = $5 per rider for every rider over 20 up to 100 max

Fields: Men’s 1-3 and Women’s 1-4 
Guaranteed Min = $700 for 20 or fewer riders
Increase = $10 per rider for every rider over 20 up to 100 max
directions: https://www.bikereg.com/the-rock-criterium

title: 2017 Silvermine Time Trial
description: The Silver Mine Time Trial is a fast, exciting 14 to 14.5 (depends on placement of finish and start) mile rolling course on smooth pavement through Harriman State Park.
course: The race starts at Silvermine Parking lot and proceeds up (slight climb) 7Lakes Drive through the first Tiorati Circle round about.   It then rolls through to the second roundabout which is Kanawauke Cirlce.
notes:
All aero equipment including but not limited to Aero bars, disc wheels and time trial bikes will be permitted for this race, other than in the "Non-TT / Eddy" classes.  

To accommodate the pre-event creation of exact start times, there will be *No* same-day registration. You must pre-register at BikeReg. ***Pre-registration Only. 

Important:  It is highly recommended that your bring a trainer for warm-up.  There is absolutely no warming up on the race course.  Anyone warming up on the course will be disqualified without exception.  There is road below the course to warm up on but again we strongly advise bringing a trainer.

Single Day USAC license available for purchase day of race ($10 additional fee paid day of event at Registration).

GPS Map: https://goo.gl/maps/YCctFGu9sQK2
directions:
Parking lot: GPS Map: https://goo.gl/maps/YCctFGu9sQK2

THe parking lot is not well defined as it relates to having a street address so please use:

https://goo.gl/maps/YCctFGu9sQK2

Or take a moment or two to find it on your nav system before heading out.  its a very well utilized State park but the maps systems dont have well defined street addresses.
But here is one that has worked reasonably well.
2801 Seven Lakes Drive, Tomkins Cove, NY

Bathrooms are in the parking lot area.

http://ridewithgps.com/routes/9530146

title: 2017 Tour the Towpath

address.city: Ending at: Inner Harbor, Syracuse, NY

description: Tour the Towpath 2017 begins in Rome, NY and follows the off-road Old Erie Canal Towpath trail for 36 miles to DeWitt, NY with an option to bike to the Inner Harbor in Syracuse (additional 10 miles). There are options to complete the ride in either one or two days.
course: There are lots of organized and spontaneous things to discover along the way! Tour the Towpath is a family friendly event and open to cyclists of all abilities. Riders will receive a map and guide to the many attractions, museums, restaurants, shops, and historic sites that they can explore in the communities between Rome and Syracuse.
directions:
Two Day- Starts at Erie Canal Village in Rome (10 am), overnight in Canastota, ends in DeWitt or Syracuse Inner Harbor (NY)
One Day- Starts at Zems Ice Cream in Canastota (8 am), ends in DeWitt or Syracuse Inner Harbor (NY)

address.street: Webster Park, Holt Road, Webster, NY

title: Syracuse Bicycle Breast Cancer Awareness Ride
description:
Join us for the 9th Annual Syracuse Bicycle Breast Cancer Awareness Ride at our new venue at Long Branch Park on Sunday, October 1, 2017!

Why we ride… 

We ride for our Mothers, Daughters, Sisters, Aunts, and our best friends. We ride for people we know and for people we don’t. We ride to raise money for research and to find a cure for breast cancer.
course: Choose your ride length...50-mile or 25-mile road rides or 10-mile Family Friendly ride on the Lakeshore Path. New this year! An 8-mile mountain bike trail ride. The proceeds from this ride benefit the Carol M. Baldwin Breast Cancer Research Fund of Central New York.

title: Muddy Tire
description: MUDDY TIRE MTB Race, new course location at Glacier Ridge
course: Intermediate to advanced singletrack
directions: Take 495 to Exit 63 Ocean Ave. (North), follow to Bicycle Path Road and make a right, go to Independance Hill Drive and make a left (Town of Brookhaven Town Hall), go to the end and park near the windmill, trail entrance is to the left of the low white building (mulched path leads to trail head/kiosk).

title: Finger Lakes Cyclocross
description: Cyclocross comes to the Finger Lakes region! The FLXCX is going to be a mix of power and technical on the beautiful grounds of Everest Park.
course: Mostly grass with some long power and hopefully some long off camber and sections of running.
notes:
CNY’s premier cyclocross race. Bring your friends & family for a day unmatched at Everest Park! 

$5 to do a second race. 

Online registration closes October 9, 2017. USAC license required, one day license available for $10.

On race day registration opens at 9:00 a.m. and closes 1/2 hours prior to start of each race. Race held rain or shine. No refunds after October 1, 2017, at which time that entry will be considered a donation. Additional fields may be added if needed. 

If you are interested in doubling up Cider Cross and FLXCX events please email info@instridesports.com.

title: The Park School CX
description: A day of cyclocross racing for all ages. Online pre-registration required at USAcycling.org.
course: The course is located entirely within the property of The Park School of Buffalo, and features a closed road section, technical sections on the grass and in the forest, off-camber turns, a gravel road climb and a stair climb. Each lap is 1.5 miles with 80+ feet total elevation gain per lap.
registration: Online registration closes at 9pm EST on Saturday, October 14th. If you have any difficulty registering online, please contact jrosen@jonrosensystems.com for assistance prior to race day. There will be limited time for race day registration and an additional fee will apply. Please help us start races on-time and provide accurate registration and results by registering online. Canadians and new users on usacycling.org are advised to register on a weekday when support is available from membership@usacycling.org. Canadian racers with a UCI license will need to send a picture of their UCI license to membership@usacycling.org to avoid paying the $10 one-day fee.
notes: Bicycle helmets requires for all races. Park at the Rich Family Activity Center, which includes access to the lockers with hot showers available.
directions: Located at 4625 Harlem Road between Main St. and Sheridan Drive, close to two exits on the I-290.

title: Holimont Cyclocross Race
description: A day of cyclocross races at the Sunset chair area of Holimont.
course: The course goes around the base area of Sunset chair and the pond.
registration: Sign up online at BikeReg.com. New racers (cat5) are encouraged to create a free account number on USAcycling.org before registering, use this account number as your license number.
notes: Race day bib pickup will be at the ski patrol building at the base of Sunset chair. Indoor bathrooms are available. All racers must sign a waiver and pickup a bib to race.
directions: Use the Canfield Hill Road entrance to access the parking lot closest to the start/finish/

title: Cider Cross
description: Join us for CNY’s premier Cyclocross and 5k run! Bring your friends & family for a day at New York’s most picturesque orchard, Beak & Skiff. 1911 Spirit’s tastings and Beak & Skiff catered food provided with entry!
course: A power course in the past but will have some new sections of barriers and technical sections.
notes:

$5 to do a second race. 

Online registration closes November 1, 2017. USAC license required, one day license available for $10.

On race day registration opens at 7:00 a.m. and closes 1/2 hours prior to start of each race. Race held rain or shine. No refunds after October 15, 2017, at which time that entry will be considered a donation. Additional fields may be added if needed. 

If you are interested in doubling up with the run-cyclocross events please email info@instridesports.com.

Pre-ride Saturday’s course with Cycle-Smart President Adam Myerson. Ride and re-ride sections, get line and technique advice, and get the course dialed for the weekend. All levels welcome. 

2 PM start, 1 hour clinic.

title: 2017 Bethlehem Cup cyclocross race
description: 2017 Bethlehem Cup cyclocross
course: Elm Avenue Park, Delmar, NY 12054
directions: plot route to 261 Elm Avenue, Delmar, NY 12054
